intro: Stachytarpheta laevis, commonly known as the silkyleaf ironweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, typically blooming in late summer to early fall. Stachytarpheta laevis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along stream banks. Its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators make it a desirable plant for ecological and horticultural purposes.
